00074 /* in client side, whether the cached locks will be canceled before replay */
00075 unsigned int ldlm_cancel_unused_locks_before_replay = 1;

00077 static void interrupted_completion_wait(void *data)
00078 {
00079 }

00081 struct lock_wait_data {
00082         struct ldlm_lock *lwd_lock;
00083         __u32             lwd_conn_cnt;
00084 };
00085 
00086 struct ldlm_async_args {
00087         struct lustre_handle lock_handle;

00090 int ldlm_expired_completion_wait(void *data)
00091 {
00092         struct lock_wait_data *lwd = data;
00093         struct ldlm_lock *lock = lwd->lwd_lock;
00094         struct obd_import *imp;
00095         struct obd_device *obd;
00096 
00097         ENTRY;
00098         if (lock->l_conn_export == NULL) {
00099                 static cfs_time_t next_dump = 0, last_dump = 0;
00100 
00101                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock timed out (enqueued at "CFS_TIME_T", "
00102                            CFS_DURATION_T"s ago); not entering recovery in "
00103                            "server code, just going back to sleep",
00104                            lock->l_last_activity,
00105                            cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_current_sec(),
00106                                         lock->l_last_activity));
00107                 if (cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(), next_dump)) {
00108                         last_dump = next_dump;
00109                         next_dump = cfs_time_shift(300);
00110                         ldlm_namespace_dump(D_DLMTRACE,
00111                                             ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock));
00112                         if (last_dump == 0)
00113                                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00114                 }
00115                 RETURN(0);
00116         }
00117 
00118         obd = lock->l_conn_export->exp_obd;
00119         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00120         ptlrpc_fail_import(imp, lwd->lwd_conn_cnt);
00121         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock timed out (enqueued at "CFS_TIME_T", "
00122                   CFS_DURATION_T"s ago), entering recovery for %s@%s",
00123                   lock->l_last_activity,
00124                   cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_current_sec(), lock->l_last_activity),
00125                   obd2cli_tgt(obd), imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
00126 
00127         RETURN(0);
00128 }

00140 /* We use the same basis for both server side and client side functions
00141    from a single node. */
00142 static unsigned int ldlm_cp_timeout(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00143 {
00144         unsigned int timeout;
00145 
00146         if (AT_OFF)
00147                 return obd_timeout;
00148 
00149         /* Wait a long time for enqueue - server may have to callback a
00150          * lock from another client.  Server will evict the other client if it
00151          * doesn't respond reasonably, and then give us the lock. */
00152         timeout = at_get(ldlm_lock_to_ns_at(lock));
00153         return max(3 * timeout, ldlm_enqueue_min);
00154 }
00155 
00160 static int ldlm_completion_tail(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data)
00161 {
00162         long delay;
00163         int  result = 0;
00164 
00165         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock) || ldlm_is_failed(lock)) {
00166                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue: destroyed");
00167                 result = -EIO;
00168         } else if (data == NULL) {
00169                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue: granted");
00170         } else {
00171                 /* Take into AT only CP RPC, not immediately granted locks */
00172                 delay = cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_current_sec(),
00173                                      lock->l_last_activity);
00174                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue: granted after "
00175                            CFS_DURATION_T"s", delay);
00176 
00177                 /* Update our time estimate */
00178                 at_measured(ldlm_lock_to_ns_at(lock), delay);
00179         }
00180         return result;
00181 }
00182 
00188 int ldlm_completion_ast_async(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags, void *data)
00189 {
00190         ENTRY;
00191 
00192         if (flags == LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC) {
00193                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue waiting on pending lock");
00194                 RETURN(0);
00195         }
00196 
00197         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK)) {
00198                 wake_up(&lock->l_waitq);
00199                 RETURN(ldlm_completion_tail(lock, data));
00200         }
00201 
00202         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue returned a blocked lock, "
00203                    "going forward");
00204         ldlm_reprocess_all(lock->l_resource);
00205         RETURN(0);
00206 }
00207 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_completion_ast_async);
00208 
00230 int ldlm_completion_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags, void *data)
00231 {
00232         /* XXX ALLOCATE - 160 bytes */
00233         struct lock_wait_data lwd;
00234         struct obd_device *obd;
00235         struct obd_import *imp = NULL;
00236         struct l_wait_info lwi;
00237         __u32 timeout;
00238         int rc = 0;
00239         ENTRY;
00240 
00241         if (flags == LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC) {
00242                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue waiting on pending lock");
00243                 goto noreproc;
00244         }
00245 
00246         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK)) {
00247                 wake_up(&lock->l_waitq);
00248                 RETURN(0);
00249         }
00250 
00251         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue returned a blocked lock, "
00252                    "sleeping");
00253 
00254 noreproc:
00255 
00256         obd = class_exp2obd(lock->l_conn_export);
00257 
00258         /* if this is a local lock, then there is no import */
00259         if (obd != NULL) {
00260                 imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00261         }
00262 
00263         timeout = ldlm_cp_timeout(lock);
00264 
00265         lwd.lwd_lock = lock;
00266         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
00267 
00268         if (ldlm_is_no_timeout(lock)) {
00269                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "waiting indefinitely because of NO_TIMEOUT");
00270                 lwi = LWI_INTR(interrupted_completion_wait, &lwd);
00271         } else {
00272                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(timeout),
00273                                        ldlm_expired_completion_wait,
00274                                        interrupted_completion_wait, &lwd);
00275         }
00276 
00277         if (imp != NULL) {
00278                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00279                 lwd.lwd_conn_cnt = imp->imp_conn_cnt;
00280                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00281         }
00282 
00283         if (ns_is_client(ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock)) &&
00284             OBD_FAIL_CHECK_RESET(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_INTR_CP_AST,
00285                                  OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_BL_RACE | OBD_FAIL_ONCE)) {
00286                 ldlm_set_fail_loc(lock);
00287                 rc = -EINTR;
00288         } else {
00289                 /* Go to sleep until the lock is granted or cancelled. */
00290                 rc = l_wait_event(lock->l_waitq,
00291                                   is_granted_or_cancelled(lock), &lwi);
00292         }
00293 
00294         if (rc) {
00295                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue waking up: failed (%d)",
00296                            rc);
00297                 RETURN(rc);
00298         }
00299 
00300         RETURN(ldlm_completion_tail(lock, data));
00301 }
00302 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_completion_ast);
00303 
00315 int ldlm_blocking_ast_nocheck(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00316 {
00317         int do_ast;
00318         ENTRY;
00319 
00320         ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00321         do_ast = (!lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers);
00322         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00323 
00324         if (do_ast) {
00325                 struct lustre_handle lockh;
00326                 int rc;
00327 
00328                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "already unused, calling ldlm_cli_cancel");
00329                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00330                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00331                 if (rc < 0)
00332                         CERROR("ldlm_cli_cancel: %d\n", rc);
00333         } else {
00334                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "Lock still has references, will be "
00335                            "cancelled later");
00336         }
00337         RETURN(0);
00338 }
00339 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_blocking_ast_nocheck);
00340 
00354 int ldlm_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00355                       void *data, int flag)
00356 {
00357         ENTRY;
00358 
00359         if (flag == LDLM_CB_CANCELING) {
00360                 /* Don't need to do anything here. */
00361                 RETURN(0);
00362         }
00363 
00364         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00365         /* Get this: if ldlm_blocking_ast is racing with intent_policy, such
00366          * that ldlm_blocking_ast is called just before intent_policy method
00367          * takes the lr_lock, then by the time we get the lock, we might not
00368          * be the correct blocking function anymore.  So check, and return
00369          * early, if so. */
00370         if (lock->l_blocking_ast != ldlm_blocking_ast) {
00371                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00372                 RETURN(0);
00373         }
00374         RETURN(ldlm_blocking_ast_nocheck(lock));
00375 }
00376 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_blocking_ast);

00407 int ldlm_glimpse_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *reqp)
00408 {
00409         return -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA;
00410 }
