00415 int ldlm_cli_enqueue_local(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
00416                            const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
00417                            enum ldlm_type type, union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
00418                            enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 *flags,
00419                            ldlm_blocking_callback blocking,
00420                            ldlm_completion_callback completion,
00421                            ldlm_glimpse_callback glimpse,
00422                            void *data, __u32 lvb_len, enum lvb_type lvb_type,
00423                            const __u64 *client_cookie,
00424                            struct lustre_handle *lockh)
00425 {
00426         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00427         int err;
00428         const struct ldlm_callback_suite cbs = { .lcs_completion = completion,
00429                                                  .lcs_blocking   = blocking,
00430                                                  .lcs_glimpse    = glimpse,
00431         };
00432         ENTRY;
00433 
00434         LASSERT(!(*flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY));
00435         if (unlikely(ns_is_client(ns))) {
00436                 CERROR("Trying to enqueue local lock in a shadow namespace\n");
00437                 LBUG();
00438         }
00439 
00440         lock = ldlm_lock_create(ns, res_id, type, mode, &cbs, data, lvb_len,
00441                                 lvb_type);
00442         if (IS_ERR(lock))
00443                 GOTO(out_nolock, err = PTR_ERR(lock));
00444 
00445         err = ldlm_lvbo_init(lock->l_resource);
00446         if (err < 0) {
00447                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "delayed lvb init failed (rc %d)", err);
00448                 GOTO(out, err);
00449         }
00450 
00451         ldlm_lock2handle(lock, lockh);
00452 
00453         /* NB: we don't have any lock now (lock_res_and_lock)
00454          * because it's a new lock */
00455         ldlm_lock_addref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00456         ldlm_set_local(lock);
00457         if (*flags & LDLM_FL_ATOMIC_CB)
00458                 ldlm_set_atomic_cb(lock);
00459 
00460         if (policy != NULL)
00461                 lock->l_policy_data = *policy;
00462         if (client_cookie != NULL)
00463                 lock->l_client_cookie = *client_cookie;
00464         if (type == LDLM_EXTENT) {
00465                 /* extent lock without policy is a bug */
00466                 if (policy == NULL)
00467                         LBUG();
00468 
00469                 lock->l_req_extent = policy->l_extent;
00470         }
00471 
00472         err = ldlm_lock_enqueue(ns, &lock, policy, flags);
00473         if (unlikely(err != ELDLM_OK))
00474                 GOTO(out, err);
00475 
00476         if (policy != NULL)
00477                 *policy = lock->l_policy_data;
00478 
00479         if (lock->l_completion_ast)
00480                 lock->l_completion_ast(lock, *flags, NULL);
00481 
00482         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side local enqueue handler, new lock created");
00483         EXIT;
00484  out:
00485         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00486  out_nolock:
00487         return err;
00488 }
00489 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_enqueue_local);
00490 
00491 static void failed_lock_cleanup(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
00492                                 struct ldlm_lock *lock, int mode)
00493 {
00494         int need_cancel = 0;
00495 
00496         /* Set a flag to prevent us from sending a CANCEL (bug 407) */
00497         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00498         /* Check that lock is not granted or failed, we might race. */
00499         if ((lock->l_req_mode != lock->l_granted_mode) &&
00500             !ldlm_is_failed(lock)) {
00501                 /* Make sure that this lock will not be found by raced
00502                  * bl_ast and -EINVAL reply is sent to server anyways.
00503                  * b=17645*/
00504                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY | LDLM_FL_FAILED |
00505                                  LDLM_FL_ATOMIC_CB | LDLM_FL_CBPENDING;
00506                 need_cancel = 1;
00507         }
00508         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00509 
00510         if (need_cancel)
00511                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock,
00512                            "setting FL_LOCAL_ONLY | LDLM_FL_FAILED | "
00513                            "LDLM_FL_ATOMIC_CB | LDLM_FL_CBPENDING");
00514         else
00515                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "lock was granted or failed in race");
00516 
00517         /* XXX - HACK because we shouldn't call ldlm_lock_destroy()
00518          *       from llite/file.c/ll_file_flock(). */
00519         /* This code makes for the fact that we do not have blocking handler on
00520          * a client for flock locks. As such this is the place where we must
00521          * completely kill failed locks. (interrupted and those that
00522          * were waiting to be granted when server evicted us. */
00523         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_FLOCK) {
00524                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00525                 if (!ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00526                         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00527                         ldlm_lock_decref_internal_nolock(lock, mode);
00528                         ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(lock);
00529                 }
00530                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00531         } else {
00532                 ldlm_lock_decref_internal(lock, mode);
00533         }
00534 }
00535 
00541 int ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00542                           enum ldlm_type type, __u8 with_policy,
00543                           enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 *flags, void *lvb,
00544                           __u32 lvb_len, const struct lustre_handle *lockh,
00545                           int rc)
00546 {
00547         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace;
00548         int is_replay = *flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY;
00549         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00550         struct ldlm_reply *reply;
00551         int cleanup_phase = 1;
00552         ENTRY;
00553 
00554         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00555         /* ldlm_cli_enqueue is holding a reference on this lock. */
00556         if (!lock) {
00557                 LASSERT(type == LDLM_FLOCK);
00558                 RETURN(-ENOLCK);
00559         }
00560 
00561         LASSERTF(ergo(lvb_len != 0, lvb_len == lock->l_lvb_len),
00562                  "lvb_len = %d, l_lvb_len = %d\n", lvb_len, lock->l_lvb_len);
00563 
00564         if (rc != ELDLM_OK) {
00565                 LASSERT(!is_replay);
00566                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue END (%s)",
00567                            rc == ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED ? "ABORTED" : "FAILED");
00568 
00569                 if (rc != ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED)
00570                         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00571         }
00572 
00573         /* Before we return, swab the reply */
00574         reply = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
00575         if (reply == NULL)
00576                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = -EPROTO);
00577 
00578         if (lvb_len > 0) {
00579                 int size = 0;
00580 
00581                 size = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB,
00582                                             RCL_SERVER);
00583                 if (size < 0) {
00584                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Fail to get lvb_len, rc = %d", size);
00585                         GOTO(cleanup, rc = size);
00586                 } else if (unlikely(size > lvb_len)) {
00587                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Replied LVB is larger than "
00588                                    "expectation, expected = %d, replied = %d",
00589                                    lvb_len, size);
00590                         GOTO(cleanup, rc = -EINVAL);
00591                 }
00592                 lvb_len = size;
00593         }
00594 
00595         if (rc == ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED) {
00596                 if (lvb_len > 0 && lvb != NULL)
00597                         rc = ldlm_fill_lvb(lock, &req->rq_pill, RCL_SERVER,
00598                                            lvb, lvb_len);
00599                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = rc ? : ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED);
00600         }
00601 
00602         /* lock enqueued on the server */
00603         cleanup_phase = 0;
00604 
00605         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00606         /* Key change rehash lock in per-export hash with new key */
00607         if (exp->exp_lock_hash) {
00608                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00609                  * ldlm_export_lock_keycmp() */
00610                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00611                 cfs_hash_rehash_key(exp->exp_lock_hash,
00612                                     &lock->l_remote_handle,
00613                                     &reply->lock_handle,
00614                                     &lock->l_exp_hash);
00615         } else {
00616                 lock->l_remote_handle = reply->lock_handle;
00617         }
00618 
00619         *flags = ldlm_flags_from_wire(reply->lock_flags);
00620         lock->l_flags |= ldlm_flags_from_wire(reply->lock_flags &
00621                                               LDLM_FL_INHERIT_MASK);
00622         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00623 
00624         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "local: %p, remote cookie: "LPX64", flags: "LPX64"\n",
00625                lock, reply->lock_handle.cookie, *flags);
00626 
00627         /* If enqueue returned a blocked lock but the completion handler has
00628          * already run, then it fixed up the resource and we don't need to do it
00629          * again. */
00630         if ((*flags) & LDLM_FL_LOCK_CHANGED) {
00631                 int newmode = reply->lock_desc.l_req_mode;
00632                 LASSERT(!is_replay);
00633                 if (newmode && newmode != lock->l_req_mode) {
00634                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server returned different mode %s",
00635                                    ldlm_lockname[newmode]);
00636                         lock->l_req_mode = newmode;
00637                 }
00638 
00639                 if (!ldlm_res_eq(&reply->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_name,
00640                                  &lock->l_resource->lr_name)) {
00641                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "remote intent success, locking "DLDLMRES
00642                                        " instead of "DLDLMRES"\n",
00643                                PLDLMRES(&reply->lock_desc.l_resource),
00644                                PLDLMRES(lock->l_resource));
00645 
00646                         rc = ldlm_lock_change_resource(ns, lock,
00647                                         &reply->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_name);
00648                         if (rc || lock->l_resource == NULL)
00649                                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = -ENOMEM);
00650                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue, new resource");
00651                 }
00652                 if (with_policy)
00653                         if (!(type == LDLM_IBITS &&
00654                               !(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS)))
00655                                 /* We assume lock type cannot change on server*/
00656                                 ldlm_convert_policy_to_local(exp,
00657                                                 lock->l_resource->lr_type,
00658                                                 &reply->lock_desc.l_policy_data,
00659                                                 &lock->l_policy_data);
00660                 if (type != LDLM_PLAIN)
00661                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock,"client-side enqueue, new policy data");
00662         }
00663 
00664         if ((*flags) & LDLM_FL_AST_SENT) {
00665                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00666                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_CBPENDING | LDLM_FL_BL_AST;
00667                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00668                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "enqueue reply includes blocking AST");
00669         }
00670 
00671         /* If the lock has already been granted by a completion AST, don't
00672          * clobber the LVB with an older one. */
00673         if (lvb_len > 0) {
00674                 /* We must lock or a racing completion might update lvb without
00675                  * letting us know and we'll clobber the correct value.
00676                  * Cannot unlock after the check either, a that still leaves
00677                  * a tiny window for completion to get in */
00678                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00679                 if (lock->l_req_mode != lock->l_granted_mode)
00680                         rc = ldlm_fill_lvb(lock, &req->rq_pill, RCL_SERVER,
00681                                            lock->l_lvb_data, lvb_len);
00682                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00683                 if (rc < 0) {
00684                         cleanup_phase = 1;
00685                         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00686                 }
00687         }
00688 
00689         if (!is_replay) {
00690                 rc = ldlm_lock_enqueue(ns, &lock, NULL, flags);
00691                 if (lock->l_completion_ast != NULL) {
00692                         int err = lock->l_completion_ast(lock, *flags, NULL);
00693                         if (!rc)
00694                                 rc = err;
00695                         if (rc)
00696                                 cleanup_phase = 1;
00697                 }
00698         }
00699 
00700         if (lvb_len > 0 && lvb != NULL) {
00701                 /* Copy the LVB here, and not earlier, because the completion
00702                  * AST (if any) can override what we got in the reply */
00703                 memcpy(lvb, lock->l_lvb_data, lvb_len);
00704         }
00705 
00706         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue END");
00707         EXIT;
00708 cleanup:
00709         if (cleanup_phase == 1 && rc)
00710                 failed_lock_cleanup(ns, lock, mode);
00711         /* Put lock 2 times, the second reference is held by ldlm_cli_enqueue */
00712         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00713         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00714         return rc;
00715 }
00716 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini);
00717 
00724 static inline int ldlm_req_handles_avail(int req_size, int off)
00725 {
00726         int avail;
00727 
00728         avail = min_t(int, LDLM_MAXREQSIZE, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 512) - req_size;
00729         if (likely(avail >= 0))
00730                 avail /= (int)sizeof(struct lustre_handle);
00731         else
00732                 avail = 0;
00733         avail += LDLM_LOCKREQ_HANDLES - off;
00734 
00735         return avail;
00736 }
00737 
00738 static inline int ldlm_capsule_handles_avail(struct req_capsule *pill,
00739                                              enum req_location loc,
00740                                              int off)
00741 {
00742         __u32 size = req_capsule_msg_size(pill, loc);
00743         return ldlm_req_handles_avail(size, off);
00744 }
00745 
00746 static inline int ldlm_format_handles_avail(struct obd_import *imp,
00747                                             const struct req_format *fmt,
00748                                             enum req_location loc, int off)
00749 {
00750         __u32 size = req_capsule_fmt_size(imp->imp_msg_magic, fmt, loc);
00751         return ldlm_req_handles_avail(size, off);
00752 }
00753 
00762 int ldlm_prep_elc_req(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00763                       int version, int opc, int canceloff,
00764                       struct list_head *cancels, int count)
00765         {
00766         struct ldlm_namespace   *ns = exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace;
00767         struct req_capsule      *pill = &req->rq_pill;
00768         struct ldlm_request     *dlm = NULL;
00769         struct list_head        head = LIST_HEAD_INIT(head);
00770         enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags;
00771         int avail, to_free, pack = 0;
00772         int rc;
00773         ENTRY;
00774 
00775         if (cancels == NULL)
00776                 cancels = &head;
00777         if (ns_connect_cancelset(ns)) {
00778                 /* Estimate the amount of available space in the request. */
00779                 req_capsule_filled_sizes(pill, RCL_CLIENT);
00780                 avail = ldlm_capsule_handles_avail(pill, RCL_CLIENT, canceloff);
00781 
00782                 lru_flags = ns_connect_lru_resize(ns) ?
00783                         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR_NO_WAIT : LDLM_LRU_FLAG_AGED;
00784                 to_free = !ns_connect_lru_resize(ns) &&
00785                         opc == LDLM_ENQUEUE ? 1 : 0;
00786 
00787                 /* Cancel LRU locks here _only_ if the server supports
00788                  * EARLY_CANCEL. Otherwise we have to send extra CANCEL
00789                  * RPC, which will make us slower. */
00790                 if (avail > count)
00791                         count += ldlm_cancel_lru_local(ns, cancels, to_free,
00792                                                        avail - count, 0,
00793                                                        lru_flags);
00794                 if (avail > count)
00795                         pack = count;
00796                 else
00797                         pack = avail;
00798                 req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ, RCL_CLIENT,
00799                                      ldlm_request_bufsize(pack, opc));
00800         }
00801 
00802         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, version, opc);
00803         if (rc) {
00804                 ldlm_lock_list_put(cancels, l_bl_ast, count);
00805                 RETURN(rc);
00806         }
00807 
00808         if (ns_connect_cancelset(ns)) {
00809                 if (canceloff) {
00810                         dlm = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00811                         LASSERT(dlm);
00812                         /* Skip first lock handler in ldlm_request_pack(),
00813                          * this method will increment @lock_count according
00814                          * to the lock handle amount actually written to
00815                          * the buffer. */
00816                         dlm->lock_count = canceloff;
00817                 }
00818                 /* Pack into the request @pack lock handles. */
00819                 ldlm_cli_cancel_list(cancels, pack, req, 0);
00820                 /* Prepare and send separate cancel RPC for others. */
00821                 ldlm_cli_cancel_list(cancels, count - pack, NULL, 0);
00822         } else {
00823                 ldlm_lock_list_put(cancels, l_bl_ast, count);
00824         }
00825         RETURN(0);
00826 }
00827 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_prep_elc_req);
00828 
00829 int ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00830                           struct list_head *cancels, int count)
00831 {
00832         return ldlm_prep_elc_req(exp, req, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION, LDLM_ENQUEUE,
00833                                  LDLM_ENQUEUE_CANCEL_OFF, cancels, count);
00834 }
00835 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_prep_enqueue_req);
00836 
00837 struct ptlrpc_request *ldlm_enqueue_pack(struct obd_export *exp, int lvb_len)
00838 {
00839         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00840         int rc;
00841         ENTRY;
00842 
00843         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE);
00844         if (req == NULL)
00845                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00846 
00847         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
00848         if (rc) {
00849                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00850                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00851         }
00852 
00853         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER, lvb_len);
00854         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00855         RETURN(req);
00856 }
00857 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_enqueue_pack);
00858 
00869 int ldlm_cli_enqueue(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_request **reqp,
00870                      struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
00871                      const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
00872                      union ldlm_policy_data const *policy, __u64 *flags,
00873                      void *lvb, __u32 lvb_len, enum lvb_type lvb_type,
00874                      struct lustre_handle *lockh, int async)
00875 {
00876         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
00877         struct ldlm_lock      *lock;
00878         struct ldlm_request   *body;
00879         int                    is_replay = *flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY;
00880         int                    req_passed_in = 1;
00881         int                    rc, err;
00882         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00883         ENTRY;
00884 
00885         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00886 
00887         ns = exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace;
00888 
00889         /* If we're replaying this lock, just check some invariants.
00890          * If we're creating a new lock, get everything all setup nice. */
00891         if (is_replay) {
00892                 lock = ldlm_handle2lock_long(lockh, 0);
00893                 LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00894                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue START");
00895                 LASSERT(exp == lock->l_conn_export);
00896         } else {
00897                 const struct ldlm_callback_suite cbs = {
00898                         .lcs_completion = einfo->ei_cb_cp,
00899                         .lcs_blocking   = einfo->ei_cb_bl,
00900                         .lcs_glimpse    = einfo->ei_cb_gl
00901                 };
00902                 lock = ldlm_lock_create(ns, res_id, einfo->ei_type,
00903                                         einfo->ei_mode, &cbs, einfo->ei_cbdata,
00904                                         lvb_len, lvb_type);
00905                 if (IS_ERR(lock))
00906                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(lock));
00907                 /* for the local lock, add the reference */
00908                 ldlm_lock_addref_internal(lock, einfo->ei_mode);
00909                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, lockh);
00910                 if (policy != NULL)
00911                         lock->l_policy_data = *policy;
00912 
00913                 if (einfo->ei_type == LDLM_EXTENT) {
00914                         /* extent lock without policy is a bug */
00915                         if (policy == NULL)
00916                                 LBUG();
00917 
00918                         lock->l_req_extent = policy->l_extent;
00919                 }
00920                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side enqueue START, flags "LPX64,
00921                            *flags);
00922         }
00923 
00924         lock->l_conn_export = exp;
00925         lock->l_export = NULL;
00926         lock->l_blocking_ast = einfo->ei_cb_bl;
00927         lock->l_flags |= (*flags & (LDLM_FL_NO_LRU | LDLM_FL_EXCL));
00928         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
00929 
00930         /* lock not sent to server yet */
00931 
00932         if (reqp == NULL || *reqp == NULL) {
00933                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00934                                                 &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE,
00935                                                 LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION,
00936                                                 LDLM_ENQUEUE);
00937                 if (req == NULL) {
00938                         failed_lock_cleanup(ns, lock, einfo->ei_mode);
00939                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00940                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00941                 }
00942                 req_passed_in = 0;
00943                 if (reqp)
00944                         *reqp = req;
00945         } else {
00946                 int len;
00947 
00948                 req = *reqp;
00949                 len = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ,
00950                                            RCL_CLIENT);
00951                 LASSERTF(len >= sizeof(*body), "buflen[%d] = %d, not %d\n",
00952                          DLM_LOCKREQ_OFF, len, (int)sizeof(*body));
00953         }
00954 
00955         /* Dump lock data into the request buffer */
00956         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00957         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &body->lock_desc);
00958         body->lock_flags = ldlm_flags_to_wire(*flags);
00959         body->lock_handle[0] = *lockh;
00960 
00961         /* Continue as normal. */
00962         if (!req_passed_in) {
00963                 if (lvb_len > 0)
00964                         req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill,
00965                                            &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE_LVB);
00966                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
00967                                      lvb_len);
00968                 ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00969         }
00970 
00971         if (async) {
00972                 LASSERT(reqp != NULL);
00973                 RETURN(0);
00974         }
00975 
00976         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "sending request");
00977 
00978         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00979 
00980         err = ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini(exp, req, einfo->ei_type, policy ? 1 : 0,
00981                                     einfo->ei_mode, flags, lvb, lvb_len,
00982                                     lockh, rc);
00983 
00984         /* If ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini did not find the lock, we need to free
00985          * one reference that we took */
00986         if (err == -ENOLCK)
00987                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00988         else
00989                 rc = err;
00990 
00991         if (!req_passed_in && req != NULL) {
00992                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00993                 if (reqp)
00994                         *reqp = NULL;
00995         }
00996 
00997         RETURN(rc);
00998 }
00999 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_enqueue);
01000 
01001 static int ldlm_cli_convert_local(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int new_mode,
01002                                   __u32 *flags)
01003 {
01004         struct ldlm_resource *res;
01005         int rc;
01006         ENTRY;
01007         if (ns_is_client(ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock))) {
01008                 CERROR("Trying to cancel local lock\n");
01009                 LBUG();
01010         }
01011         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side local convert");
01012 
01013         res = ldlm_lock_convert(lock, new_mode, flags);
01014         if (res) {
01015                 ldlm_reprocess_all(res);
01016                 rc = 0;
01017         } else {
01018                 rc = LUSTRE_EDEADLK;
01019         }
01020         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side local convert handler END");
01021         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01022         RETURN(rc);
01023 }
01024 
01025 /* FIXME: one of ldlm_cli_convert or the server side should reject attempted
01026  * conversion of locks which are on the waiting or converting queue */
01027 /* Caller of this code is supposed to take care of lock readers/writers
01028    accounting */
01029 int ldlm_cli_convert(const struct lustre_handle *lockh, int new_mode,
01030                      __u32 *flags)
01031 {
01032         struct ldlm_request   *body;
01033         struct ldlm_reply     *reply;
01034         struct ldlm_lock      *lock;
01035         struct ldlm_resource  *res;
01036         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01037         int                    rc;
01038         ENTRY;
01039 
01040         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
01041         if (!lock) {
01042                 LBUG();
01043                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01044         }
01045         *flags = 0;
01046 
01047         if (lock->l_conn_export == NULL)
01048                 RETURN(ldlm_cli_convert_local(lock, new_mode, flags));
01049 
01050         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side convert");
01051 
01052         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(lock->l_conn_export),
01053                                         &RQF_LDLM_CONVERT, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION,
01054                                         LDLM_CONVERT);
01055         if (req == NULL) {
01056                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01057                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01058         }
01059 
01060         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01061         body->lock_handle[0] = lock->l_remote_handle;
01062 
01063         body->lock_desc.l_req_mode = new_mode;
01064         body->lock_flags = ldlm_flags_to_wire(*flags);
01065 
01066 
01067         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01068         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01069         if (rc != ELDLM_OK)
01070                 GOTO(out, rc);
01071 
01072         reply = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
01073         if (reply == NULL)
01074                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01075 
01076         if (req->rq_status)
01077                 GOTO(out, rc = req->rq_status);
01078 
01079         res = ldlm_lock_convert(lock, new_mode, &reply->lock_flags);
01080         if (res != NULL) {
01081                 ldlm_reprocess_all(res);
01082                 /* Go to sleep until the lock is granted. */
01083                 /* FIXME: or cancelled. */
01084                 if (lock->l_completion_ast) {
01085                         rc = lock->l_completion_ast(lock, LDLM_FL_WAIT_NOREPROC,
01086                                                     NULL);
01087                         if (rc)
01088                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01089                 }
01090         } else {
01091                 rc = LUSTRE_EDEADLK;
01092         }
01093         EXIT;
01094  out:
01095         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01096         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01097         return rc;
01098 }
01099 
01107 static __u64 ldlm_cli_cancel_local(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01108 {
01109         __u64 rc = LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY;
01110         ENTRY;
01111 
01112         if (lock->l_conn_export) {
01113                 bool local_only;
01114 
01115                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client-side cancel");
01116                 /* Set this flag to prevent others from getting new references*/
01117                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01118                 ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
01119                 local_only = !!(lock->l_flags &
01120                                 (LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY|LDLM_FL_CANCEL_ON_BLOCK));
01121                 ldlm_cancel_callback(lock);
01122                 rc = (ldlm_is_bl_ast(lock)) ?
01123                         LDLM_FL_BL_AST : LDLM_FL_CANCELING;
01124                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01125 
01126                 if (local_only) {
01127                         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "not sending request (at caller's "
01128                                "instruction)\n");
01129                         rc = LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY;
01130                 }
01131                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01132         } else {
01133                 if (ns_is_client(ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock))) {
01134                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Trying to cancel local lock");
01135                         LBUG();
01136                 }
01137                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server-side local cancel");
01138                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01139                 ldlm_reprocess_all(lock->l_resource);
01140         }
01141 
01142         RETURN(rc);
01143 }
01144 
01148 static void ldlm_cancel_pack(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01149                              struct list_head *head, int count)
01150 {
01151         struct ldlm_request *dlm;
01152         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01153         int max, packed = 0;
01154         ENTRY;
01155 
01156         dlm = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01157         LASSERT(dlm != NULL);
01158 
01159         /* Check the room in the request buffer. */
01160         max = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ, RCL_CLIENT) -
01161                 sizeof(struct ldlm_request);
01162         max /= sizeof(struct lustre_handle);
01163         max += LDLM_LOCKREQ_HANDLES;
01164         LASSERT(max >= dlm->lock_count + count);
01165 
01166         /* XXX: it would be better to pack lock handles grouped by resource.
01167          * so that the server cancel would call filter_lvbo_update() less
01168          * frequently. */
01169         list_for_each_entry(lock, head, l_bl_ast) {
01170                 if (!count--)
01171                         break;
01172                 LASSERT(lock->l_conn_export);
01173                 /* Pack the lock handle to the given request buffer. */
01174                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "packing");
01175                 dlm->lock_handle[dlm->lock_count++] = lock->l_remote_handle;
01176                 packed++;
01177         }
01178         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "%d locks packed\n", packed);
01179         EXIT;
01180 }
01181 
01185 int ldlm_cli_cancel_req(struct obd_export *exp, struct list_head *cancels,
01186                         int count, enum ldlm_cancel_flags flags)
01187 {
01188         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
01189         struct obd_import *imp;
01190         int free, sent = 0;
01191         int rc = 0;
01192         ENTRY;
01193 
01194         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
01195         LASSERT(count > 0);
01196 
01197         CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_PAUSE_CANCEL, cfs_fail_val);
01198 
01199         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CANCEL_RACE))
01200                 RETURN(count);
01201 
01202         free = ldlm_format_handles_avail(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01203                                          &RQF_LDLM_CANCEL, RCL_CLIENT, 0);
01204         if (count > free)
01205                 count = free;
01206 
01207         while (1) {
01208                 imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
01209                 if (imp == NULL || imp->imp_invalid) {
01210                         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE,
01211                                "skipping cancel on invalid import %p\n", imp);
01212                         RETURN(count);
01213                 }
01214 
01215                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_LDLM_CANCEL);
01216                 if (req == NULL)
01217                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01218 
01219                 req_capsule_filled_sizes(&req->rq_pill, RCL_CLIENT);
01220                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ, RCL_CLIENT,
01221                                      ldlm_request_bufsize(count, LDLM_CANCEL));
01222 
01223                 rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION, LDLM_CANCEL);
01224                 if (rc) {
01225                         ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01226                         GOTO(out, rc);
01227                 }
01228 
01229                 /* If OSP want cancel cross-MDT lock, let's not block it in
01230                  * in recovery, otherwise the lock will not released, if
01231                  * the remote target is also in recovery, and it also need
01232                  * this lock, it might cause deadlock. */
01233                 if (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS &&
01234                     exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev != NULL &&
01235                     exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site != NULL) {
01236                         struct lu_device *top_dev;
01237 
01238                         top_dev = exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site->ls_top_dev;
01239                         if (top_dev != NULL &&
01240                             top_dev->ld_obd->obd_recovering)
01241                                 req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
01242                 }
01243 
01244                 req->rq_request_portal = LDLM_CANCEL_REQUEST_PORTAL;
01245                 req->rq_reply_portal = LDLM_CANCEL_REPLY_PORTAL;
01246                 ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01247 
01248                 ldlm_cancel_pack(req, cancels, count);
01249 
01250                 ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01251                 if (flags & LCF_ASYNC) {
01252                         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
01253                         sent = count;
01254                         GOTO(out, 0);
01255                 }
01256 
01257                 rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01258                 if (rc == LUSTRE_ESTALE) {
01259                         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "client/server (nid %s) "
01260                                "out of sync -- not fatal\n",
01261                                libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_import->
01262                                               imp_connection->c_peer.nid));
01263                         rc = 0;
01264                 } else if (rc == -ETIMEDOUT && /* check there was no reconnect*/
01265                            req->rq_import_generation == imp->imp_generation) {
01266                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01267                         continue;
01268                 } else if (rc != ELDLM_OK) {
01269                         /* -ESHUTDOWN is common on umount */
01270                         CDEBUG_LIMIT(rc == -ESHUTDOWN ? D_DLMTRACE : D_ERROR,
01271                                      "Got rc %d from cancel RPC: "
01272                                      "canceling anyway\n", rc);
01273                         break;
01274                 }
01275                 sent = count;
01276                 break;
01277         }
01278 
01279         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01280         EXIT;
01281 out:
01282         return sent ? sent : rc;
01283 }
01284 
01285 static inline struct ldlm_pool *ldlm_imp2pl(struct obd_import *imp)
01286 {
01287         LASSERT(imp != NULL);
01288         return &imp->imp_obd->obd_namespace->ns_pool;
01289 }
01290 
01294 int ldlm_cli_update_pool(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01295 {
01296         struct obd_device *obd;
01297         __u64 new_slv;
01298         __u32 new_limit;
01299         ENTRY;
01300         if (unlikely(!req->rq_import || !req->rq_import->imp_obd ||
01301                      !imp_connect_lru_resize(req->rq_import)))
01302         {
01303                 /*
01304                  * Do nothing for corner cases.
01305                  */
01306                 RETURN(0);
01307         }
01308 
01309         /* In some cases RPC may contain SLV and limit zeroed out. This
01310          * is the case when server does not support LRU resize feature.
01311          * This is also possible in some recovery cases when server-side
01312          * reqs have no reference to the OBD export and thus access to
01313          * server-side namespace is not possible. */
01314         if (lustre_msg_get_slv(req->rq_repmsg) == 0 ||
01315             lustre_msg_get_limit(req->rq_repmsg) == 0) {
01316                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "Zero SLV or Limit found "
01317                           "(SLV: "LPU64", Limit: %u)",
01318                           lustre_msg_get_slv(req->rq_repmsg),
01319                           lustre_msg_get_limit(req->rq_repmsg));
01320                 RETURN(0);
01321         }
01322 
01323         new_limit = lustre_msg_get_limit(req->rq_repmsg);
01324         new_slv = lustre_msg_get_slv(req->rq_repmsg);
01325         obd = req->rq_import->imp_obd;
01326 
01327         /* Set new SLV and limit in OBD fields to make them accessible
01328          * to the pool thread. We do not access obd_namespace and pool
01329          * directly here as there is no reliable way to make sure that
01330          * they are still alive at cleanup time. Evil races are possible
01331          * which may cause Oops at that time. */
01332         write_lock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
01333         obd->obd_pool_slv = new_slv;
01334         obd->obd_pool_limit = new_limit;
01335         write_unlock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
01336 
01337         RETURN(0);
01338 }
01339 
01345 int ldlm_cli_cancel(const struct lustre_handle *lockh,
01346                     enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
01347 {
01348         struct obd_export *exp;
01349         enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags;
01350         int avail, count = 1;
01351         __u64 rc = 0;
01352         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
01353         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01354         struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
01355         ENTRY;
01356 
01357         lock = ldlm_handle2lock_long(lockh, 0);
01358         if (lock == NULL) {
01359                 LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("lock is already being destroyed");
01360                 RETURN(0);
01361         }
01362 
01363         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01364         /* Lock is being canceled and the caller doesn't want to wait */
01365         if (ldlm_is_canceling(lock) && (cancel_flags & LCF_ASYNC)) {
01366                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01367                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01368                 RETURN(0);
01369         }
01370 
01371         ldlm_set_canceling(lock);
01372         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01373 
01374         rc = ldlm_cli_cancel_local(lock);
01375         if (rc == LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY || cancel_flags & LCF_LOCAL) {
01376                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01377                 RETURN(0);
01378         }
01379         /* Even if the lock is marked as LDLM_FL_BL_AST, this is a LDLM_CANCEL
01380          * RPC which goes to canceld portal, so we can cancel other LRU locks
01381          * here and send them all as one LDLM_CANCEL RPC. */
01382         LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_bl_ast));
01383         list_add(&lock->l_bl_ast, &cancels);
01384 
01385         exp = lock->l_conn_export;
01386         if (exp_connect_cancelset(exp)) {
01387                 avail = ldlm_format_handles_avail(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01388                                                   &RQF_LDLM_CANCEL,
01389                                                   RCL_CLIENT, 0);
01390                 LASSERT(avail > 0);
01391 
01392                 ns = ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock);
01393                 lru_flags = ns_connect_lru_resize(ns) ?
01394                         LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR : LDLM_LRU_FLAG_AGED;
01395                 count += ldlm_cancel_lru_local(ns, &cancels, 0, avail - 1,
01396                                                LCF_BL_AST, lru_flags);
01397         }
01398         ldlm_cli_cancel_list(&cancels, count, NULL, cancel_flags);
01399         RETURN(0);
01400 }
01401 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_cancel);
01402 
01407 int ldlm_cli_cancel_list_local(struct list_head *cancels, int count,
01408                                enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
01409 {
01410         struct list_head head = LIST_HEAD_INIT(head);
01411         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *next;
01412         int left = 0, bl_ast = 0;
01413         __u64 rc;
01414 
01415         left = count;
01416         list_for_each_entry_safe(lock, next, cancels, l_bl_ast) {
01417                 if (left-- == 0)
01418                         break;
01419 
01420                 if (cancel_flags & LCF_LOCAL) {
01421                         rc = LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY;
01422                         ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01423                 } else {
01424                         rc = ldlm_cli_cancel_local(lock);
01425                 }
01426                 /* Until we have compound requests and can send LDLM_CANCEL
01427                  * requests batched with generic RPCs, we need to send cancels
01428                  * with the LDLM_FL_BL_AST flag in a separate RPC from
01429                  * the one being generated now. */
01430                 if (!(cancel_flags & LCF_BL_AST) && (rc == LDLM_FL_BL_AST)) {
01431                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "Cancel lock separately");
01432                         list_del_init(&lock->l_bl_ast);
01433                         list_add(&lock->l_bl_ast, &head);
01434                         bl_ast++;
01435                         continue;
01436                 }
01437                 if (rc == LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY) {
01438                         /* CANCEL RPC should not be sent to server. */
01439                         list_del_init(&lock->l_bl_ast);
01440                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01441                         count--;
01442                 }
01443         }
01444         if (bl_ast > 0) {
01445                 count -= bl_ast;
01446                 ldlm_cli_cancel_list(&head, bl_ast, NULL, 0);
01447         }
01448 
01449         RETURN(count);
01450 }
01451 
01457 static enum ldlm_policy_res
01458 ldlm_cancel_no_wait_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01459                            int unused, int added, int count)
01460 {
01461         enum ldlm_policy_res result = LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01462 
01463         /* don't check added & count since we want to process all locks
01464          * from unused list.
01465          * It's fine to not take lock to access lock->l_resource since
01466          * the lock has already been granted so it won't change. */
01467         switch (lock->l_resource->lr_type) {
01468                 case LDLM_EXTENT:
01469                 case LDLM_IBITS:
01470                         if (ns->ns_cancel != NULL && ns->ns_cancel(lock) != 0)
01471                                 break;
01472                 default:
01473                         result = LDLM_POLICY_SKIP_LOCK;
01474                         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01475                         ldlm_set_skipped(lock);
01476                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01477                         break;
01478         }
01479 
01480         RETURN(result);
01481 }
01482 
01492 static enum ldlm_policy_res ldlm_cancel_lrur_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01493                                                     struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01494                                                     int unused, int added,
01495                                                     int count)
01496 {
01497         cfs_time_t cur = cfs_time_current();
01498         struct ldlm_pool *pl = &ns->ns_pool;
01499         __u64 slv, lvf, lv;
01500         cfs_time_t la;
01501 
01502         /* Stop LRU processing when we reach past @count or have checked all
01503          * locks in LRU. */
01504         if (count && added >= count)
01505                 return LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK;
01506 
01507         /* Despite of the LV, It doesn't make sense to keep the lock which
01508          * is unused for ns_max_age time. */
01509         if (cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(),
01510                            cfs_time_add(lock->l_last_used, ns->ns_max_age)))
01511                 return LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01512 
01513         slv = ldlm_pool_get_slv(pl);
01514         lvf = ldlm_pool_get_lvf(pl);
01515         la = cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(cur,
01516                               lock->l_last_used));
01517         lv = lvf * la * unused;
01518 
01519         /* Inform pool about current CLV to see it via proc. */
01520         ldlm_pool_set_clv(pl, lv);
01521 
01522         /* Stop when SLV is not yet come from server or lv is smaller than
01523          * it is. */
01524         if (slv == 0 || lv < slv)
01525                 return LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK;
01526 
01527         return LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01528 }
01529 
01530 static enum ldlm_policy_res
01531 ldlm_cancel_lrur_no_wait_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01532                                 struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01533                                 int unused, int added,
01534                                 int count)
01535 {
01536         enum ldlm_policy_res result;
01537 
01538         result = ldlm_cancel_lrur_policy(ns, lock, unused, added, count);
01539         if (result == LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK)
01540                 return result;
01541 
01542         return ldlm_cancel_no_wait_policy(ns, lock, unused, added, count);
01543 }
01544 
01554 static enum ldlm_policy_res ldlm_cancel_passed_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01555                                                       struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01556                                                       int unused, int added,
01557                                                       int count)
01558 {
01559         /* Stop LRU processing when we reach past @count or have checked all
01560          * locks in LRU. */
01561         return (added >= count) ?
01562                 LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK : LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01563 }
01564 
01574 static enum ldlm_policy_res ldlm_cancel_aged_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01575                                                     struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01576                                                     int unused, int added,
01577                                                     int count)
01578 {
01579         if ((added >= count) &&
01580             cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
01581                             cfs_time_add(lock->l_last_used, ns->ns_max_age)))
01582                 return LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK;
01583 
01584         return LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01585 }
01586 
01596 static
01597 enum ldlm_policy_res ldlm_cancel_default_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01598                                                 struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01599                                                 int unused, int added,
01600                                                 int count)
01601 {
01602         /* Stop LRU processing when we reach past count or have checked all
01603          * locks in LRU. */
01604         return (added >= count) ?
01605                 LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK : LDLM_POLICY_CANCEL_LOCK;
01606 }
01607 
01608 typedef enum ldlm_policy_res
01609 (*ldlm_cancel_lru_policy_t)(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock *lock,
01610                             int unused, int added, int count);
01611 
01612 static ldlm_cancel_lru_policy_t
01613 ldlm_cancel_lru_policy(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags)
01614 {
01615         if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_NO_WAIT)
01616                 return ldlm_cancel_no_wait_policy;
01617 
01618         if (ns_connect_lru_resize(ns)) {
01619                 if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_SHRINK)
01620                         /* We kill passed number of old locks. */
01621                         return ldlm_cancel_passed_policy;
01622                 if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR)
01623                         return ldlm_cancel_lrur_policy;
01624                 if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_PASSED)
01625                         return ldlm_cancel_passed_policy;
01626                 else if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR_NO_WAIT)
01627                         return ldlm_cancel_lrur_no_wait_policy;
01628         } else {
01629                 if (lru_flags & LDLM_LRU_FLAG_AGED)
01630                         return ldlm_cancel_aged_policy;
01631         }
01632 
01633         return ldlm_cancel_default_policy;
01634 }
01635 
01669 static int ldlm_prepare_lru_list(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01670                                  struct list_head *cancels, int count, int max,
01671                                  enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags)
01672 {
01673         ldlm_cancel_lru_policy_t pf;
01674         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *next;
01675         int added = 0, unused, remained;
01676         int no_wait = lru_flags & (LDLM_LRU_FLAG_NO_WAIT |
01677                                    LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR_NO_WAIT);
01678         ENTRY;
01679 
01680         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01681         unused = ns->ns_nr_unused;
01682         remained = unused;
01683 
01684         if (!ns_connect_lru_resize(ns))
01685                 count += unused - ns->ns_max_unused;
01686 
01687         pf = ldlm_cancel_lru_policy(ns, lru_flags);
01688         LASSERT(pf != NULL);
01689 
01690         while (!list_empty(&ns->ns_unused_list)) {
01691                 enum ldlm_policy_res result;
01692                 cfs_time_t last_use = 0;
01693 
01694                 /* all unused locks */
01695                 if (remained-- <= 0)
01696                         break;
01697 
01698                 /* For any flags, stop scanning if @max is reached. */
01699                 if (max && added >= max)
01700                         break;
01701 
01702                 list_for_each_entry_safe(lock, next, &ns->ns_unused_list,
01703                                          l_lru) {
01704                         /* No locks which got blocking requests. */
01705                         LASSERT(!ldlm_is_bl_ast(lock));
01706 
01707                         if (no_wait && ldlm_is_skipped(lock))
01708                                 /* already processed */
01709                                 continue;
01710 
01711                         last_use = lock->l_last_used;
01712                         if (last_use == cfs_time_current())
01713                                 continue;
01714 
01715                         /* Somebody is already doing CANCEL. No need for this
01716                          * lock in LRU, do not traverse it again. */
01717                         if (!ldlm_is_canceling(lock))
01718                                 break;
01719 
01720                         ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_nolock(lock);
01721                 }
01722                 if (&lock->l_lru == &ns->ns_unused_list)
01723                         break;
01724 
01725                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
01726                 spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
01727                 lu_ref_add(&lock->l_reference, __FUNCTION__, current);
01728 
01729                 /* Pass the lock through the policy filter and see if it
01730                  * should stay in LRU.
01731                  *
01732                  * Even for shrinker policy we stop scanning if
01733                  * we find a lock that should stay in the cache.
01734                  * We should take into account lock age anyway
01735                  * as a new lock is a valuable resource even if
01736                  * it has a low weight.
01737                  *
01738                  * That is, for shrinker policy we drop only
01739                  * old locks, but additionally choose them by
01740                  * their weight. Big extent locks will stay in
01741                  * the cache. */
01742                 result = pf(ns, lock, unused, added, count);
01743                 if (result == LDLM_POLICY_KEEP_LOCK) {
01744                         lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference,
01745                                    __FUNCTION__, current);
01746                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01747                         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01748                         break;
01749                 }
01750                 if (result == LDLM_POLICY_SKIP_LOCK) {
01751                         lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference,
01752                                    __func__, current);
01753                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01754                         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01755                         continue;
01756                 }
01757 
01758                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01759                 /* Check flags again under the lock. */
01760                 if (ldlm_is_canceling(lock) ||
01761                     ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru_check(lock, last_use) == 0) {
01762                         /* Another thread is removing lock from LRU, or
01763                          * somebody is already doing CANCEL, or there
01764                          * is a blocking request which will send cancel
01765                          * by itself, or the lock is no longer unused or
01766                          * the lock has been used since the pf() call and
01767                          * pages could be put under it. */
01768                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01769                         lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, __FUNCTION__, current);
01770                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01771                         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01772                         continue;
01773                 }
01774                 LASSERT(!lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers);
01775 
01776                 /* If we have chosen to cancel this lock voluntarily, we
01777                  * better send cancel notification to server, so that it
01778                  * frees appropriate state. This might lead to a race
01779                  * where while we are doing cancel here, server is also
01780                  * silently cancelling this lock. */
01781                 ldlm_clear_cancel_on_block(lock);
01782 
01783                 /* Setting the CBPENDING flag is a little misleading,
01784                  * but prevents an important race; namely, once
01785                  * CBPENDING is set, the lock can accumulate no more
01786                  * readers/writers. Since readers and writers are
01787                  * already zero here, ldlm_lock_decref() won't see
01788                  * this flag and call l_blocking_ast */
01789                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_CBPENDING | LDLM_FL_CANCELING;
01790 
01791                 /* We can't re-add to l_lru as it confuses the
01792                  * refcounting in ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru() if an AST
01793                  * arrives after we drop lr_lock below. We use l_bl_ast
01794                  * and can't use l_pending_chain as it is used both on
01795                  * server and client nevertheless bug 5666 says it is
01796                  * used only on server */
01797                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_bl_ast));
01798                 list_add(&lock->l_bl_ast, cancels);
01799                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01800                 lu_ref_del(&lock->l_reference, __FUNCTION__, current);
01801                 spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01802                 added++;
01803                 unused--;
01804         }
01805         spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
01806         RETURN(added);
01807 }
01808 
01809 int ldlm_cancel_lru_local(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct list_head *cancels,
01810                           int count, int max,
01811                           enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags,
01812                           enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags)
01813 {
01814         int added;
01815 
01816         added = ldlm_prepare_lru_list(ns, cancels, count, max, lru_flags);
01817         if (added <= 0)
01818                 return added;
01819 
01820         return ldlm_cli_cancel_list_local(cancels, added, cancel_flags);
01821 }
01822 
01831 int ldlm_cancel_lru(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, int nr,
01832                     enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags,
01833                     enum ldlm_lru_flags lru_flags)
01834 {
01835         struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
01836         int count, rc;
01837         ENTRY;
01838 
01839         /* Just prepare the list of locks, do not actually cancel them yet.
01840          * Locks are cancelled later in a separate thread. */
01841         count = ldlm_prepare_lru_list(ns, &cancels, nr, 0, lru_flags);
01842         rc = ldlm_bl_to_thread_list(ns, NULL, &cancels, count, cancel_flags);
01843         if (rc == 0)
01844                 RETURN(count);
01845 
01846         RETURN(0);
01847 }
01848 
01854 int ldlm_cancel_resource_local(struct ldlm_resource *res,
01855                                struct list_head *cancels,
01856                                union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
01857                                enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 lock_flags,
01858                                enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags,
01859                                void *opaque)
01860 {
01861         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01862         int count = 0;
01863         ENTRY;
01864 
01865         lock_res(res);
01866         list_for_each_entry(lock, &res->lr_granted, l_res_link) {
01867                 if (opaque != NULL && lock->l_ast_data != opaque) {
01868                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "data %p doesn't match opaque %p",
01869                                    lock->l_ast_data, opaque);
01870                         //LBUG();
01871                         continue;
01872                 }
01873 
01874                 if (lock->l_readers || lock->l_writers)
01875                         continue;
01876 
01877                 /* If somebody is already doing CANCEL, or blocking AST came,
01878                  * skip this lock. */
01879                 if (ldlm_is_bl_ast(lock) || ldlm_is_canceling(lock))
01880                         continue;
01881 
01882                 if (lockmode_compat(lock->l_granted_mode, mode))
01883                         continue;
01884 
01885                 /* If policy is given and this is IBITS lock, add to list only
01886                  * those locks that match by policy. */
01887                 if (policy && (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_IBITS) &&
01888                     !(lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits &
01889                       policy->l_inodebits.bits))
01890                         continue;
01891 
01892                 /* See CBPENDING comment in ldlm_cancel_lru */
01893                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_CBPENDING | LDLM_FL_CANCELING |
01894                                  lock_flags;
01895 
01896                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lock->l_bl_ast));
01897                 list_add(&lock->l_bl_ast, cancels);
01898                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
01899                 count++;
01900         }
01901         unlock_res(res);
01902 
01903         RETURN(ldlm_cli_cancel_list_local(cancels, count, cancel_flags));
01904 }
01905 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cancel_resource_local);
01906 
01917 int ldlm_cli_cancel_list(struct list_head *cancels, int count,
01918                          struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01919                          enum ldlm_cancel_flags flags)
01920 {
01921         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01922         int res = 0;
01923         ENTRY;
01924 
01925         if (list_empty(cancels) || count == 0)
01926                 RETURN(0);
01927 
01928         /* XXX: requests (both batched and not) could be sent in parallel.
01929          * Usually it is enough to have just 1 RPC, but it is possible that
01930          * there are too many locks to be cancelled in LRU or on a resource.
01931          * It would also speed up the case when the server does not support
01932          * the feature. */
01933         while (count > 0) {
01934                 LASSERT(!list_empty(cancels));
01935                 lock = list_entry(cancels->next, struct ldlm_lock,
01936                                       l_bl_ast);
01937                 LASSERT(lock->l_conn_export);
01938 
01939                 if (exp_connect_cancelset(lock->l_conn_export)) {
01940                         res = count;
01941                         if (req)
01942                                 ldlm_cancel_pack(req, cancels, count);
01943                         else
01944                                 res = ldlm_cli_cancel_req(lock->l_conn_export,
01945                                                           cancels, count,
01946                                                           flags);
01947                 } else {
01948                         res = ldlm_cli_cancel_req(lock->l_conn_export,
01949                                                   cancels, 1, flags);
01950                 }
01951 
01952                 if (res < 0) {
01953                         CDEBUG_LIMIT(res == -ESHUTDOWN ? D_DLMTRACE : D_ERROR,
01954                                      "ldlm_cli_cancel_list: %d\n", res);
01955                         res = count;
01956                 }
01957 
01958                 count -= res;
01959                 ldlm_lock_list_put(cancels, l_bl_ast, res);
01960         }
01961         LASSERT(count == 0);
01962         RETURN(0);
01963 }
01964 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_cancel_list);
01965 
01971 int ldlm_cli_cancel_unused_resource(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01972                                     const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
01973                                     union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
01974                                     enum ldlm_mode mode,
01975                                     enum ldlm_cancel_flags flags, void *opaque)
01976 {
01977         struct ldlm_resource *res;
01978         struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
01979         int count;
01980         int rc;
01981         ENTRY;
01982 
01983         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, res_id, 0, 0);
01984         if (IS_ERR(res)) {
01985                 /* This is not a problem. */
01986                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "No resource "LPU64"\n", res_id->name[0]);
01987                 RETURN(0);
01988         }
01989 
01990         LDLM_RESOURCE_ADDREF(res);
01991         count = ldlm_cancel_resource_local(res, &cancels, policy, mode,
01992                                            0, flags | LCF_BL_AST, opaque);
01993         rc = ldlm_cli_cancel_list(&cancels, count, NULL, flags);
01994         if (rc != ELDLM_OK)
01995                 CERROR("canceling unused lock "DLDLMRES": rc = %d\n",
01996                        PLDLMRES(res), rc);
01997 
01998         LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(res);
01999         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
02000         RETURN(0);
02001 }
02002 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_cli_cancel_unused_resource);
02003 
02004 struct ldlm_cli_cancel_arg {
02005         int     lc_flags;
02006         void   *lc_opaque;
02007 };
02008 
02009 static int
02010 ldlm_cli_hash_cancel_unused(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
02011                             struct hlist_node *hnode, void *arg)
02012 {
02013         struct ldlm_resource           *res = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02014         struct ldlm_cli_cancel_arg     *lc = arg;
02015 
02016         ldlm_cli_cancel_unused_resource(ldlm_res_to_ns(res), &res->lr_name,
02017                                         NULL, LCK_MINMODE, lc->lc_flags,
02018                                         lc->lc_opaque);
02019         /* must return 0 for hash iteration */
02020         return 0;
02021 }
02022 
02029 int ldlm_cli_cancel_unused(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
02030                            const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
02031                            enum ldlm_cancel_flags flags, void *opaque)
02032 {
02033         struct ldlm_cli_cancel_arg arg = {
02034                 .lc_flags       = flags,
02035                 .lc_opaque      = opaque,
02036         };
02037 
02038         ENTRY;
02039 
02040         if (ns == NULL)
02041                 RETURN(ELDLM_OK);
02042 
02043         if (res_id != NULL) {
02044                 RETURN(ldlm_cli_cancel_unused_resource(ns, res_id, NULL,
02045                                                        LCK_MINMODE, flags,
02046                                                        opaque));
02047         } else {
02048                 cfs_hash_for_each_nolock(ns->ns_rs_hash,
02049                                          ldlm_cli_hash_cancel_unused, &arg, 0);
02050                 RETURN(ELDLM_OK);
02051         }
02052 }
02053 
02054 /* Lock iterators. */
02055 
02056 int ldlm_resource_foreach(struct ldlm_resource *res, ldlm_iterator_t iter,
02057                           void *closure)
02058 {
02059         struct list_head *tmp, *next;
02060         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02061         int rc = LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE;
02062 
02063         ENTRY;
02064 
02065         if (!res)
02066                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
02067 
02068         lock_res(res);
02069         list_for_each_safe(tmp, next, &res->lr_granted) {
02070                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
02071 
02072                 if (iter(lock, closure) == LDLM_ITER_STOP)
02073                         GOTO(out, rc = LDLM_ITER_STOP);
02074         }
02075 
02076         list_for_each_safe(tmp, next, &res->lr_converting) {
02077                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
02078 
02079                 if (iter(lock, closure) == LDLM_ITER_STOP)
02080                         GOTO(out, rc = LDLM_ITER_STOP);
02081         }
02082 
02083         list_for_each_safe(tmp, next, &res->lr_waiting) {
02084                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
02085 
02086                 if (iter(lock, closure) == LDLM_ITER_STOP)
02087                         GOTO(out, rc = LDLM_ITER_STOP);
02088         }
02089  out:
02090         unlock_res(res);
02091         RETURN(rc);
02092 }
02093 
02094 struct iter_helper_data {
02095         ldlm_iterator_t iter;
02096         void *closure;
02097 };
02098 
02099 static int ldlm_iter_helper(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *closure)
02100 {
02101         struct iter_helper_data *helper = closure;
02102         return helper->iter(lock, helper->closure);
02103 }
02104 
02105 static int ldlm_res_iter_helper(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
02106                                 struct hlist_node *hnode, void *arg)
02107 
02108 {
02109         struct ldlm_resource *res = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02110 
02111         return ldlm_resource_foreach(res, ldlm_iter_helper, arg) ==
02112                LDLM_ITER_STOP;
02113 }
02114 
02115 void ldlm_namespace_foreach(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
02116                             ldlm_iterator_t iter, void *closure)
02117 
02118 {
02119         struct iter_helper_data helper = { .iter = iter, .closure = closure };
02120 
02121         cfs_hash_for_each_nolock(ns->ns_rs_hash,
02122                                  ldlm_res_iter_helper, &helper, 0);
02123 
02124 }
02125 
02126 /* non-blocking function to manipulate a lock whose cb_data is being put away.
02127  * return  0:  find no resource
02128  *       > 0:  must be LDLM_ITER_STOP/LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE.
02129  *       < 0:  errors
02130  */
02131 int ldlm_resource_iterate(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
02132                           const struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
02133                           ldlm_iterator_t iter, void *data)
02134 {
02135         struct ldlm_resource *res;
02136         int rc;
02137         ENTRY;
02138 
02139         LASSERTF(ns != NULL, "must pass in namespace\n");
02140 
02141         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, res_id, 0, 0);
02142         if (IS_ERR(res))
02143                 RETURN(0);
02144 
02145         LDLM_RESOURCE_ADDREF(res);
02146         rc = ldlm_resource_foreach(res, iter, data);
02147         LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(res);
02148         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
02149         RETURN(rc);
02150 }
02151 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_resource_iterate);
02152 
02153 /* Lock replay */
02154 
02155 static int ldlm_chain_lock_for_replay(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *closure)
02156 {
02157         struct list_head *list = closure;
02158 
02159         /* we use l_pending_chain here, because it's unused on clients. */
02160         LASSERTF(list_empty(&lock->l_pending_chain),
02161                  "lock %p next %p prev %p\n",
02162                  lock, &lock->l_pending_chain.next,&lock->l_pending_chain.prev);
02163         /* bug 9573: don't replay locks left after eviction, or
02164          * bug 17614: locks being actively cancelled. Get a reference
02165          * on a lock so that it does not disapear under us (e.g. due to cancel)
02166          */
02167         if (!(lock->l_flags & (LDLM_FL_FAILED|LDLM_FL_CANCELING))) {
02168                 list_add(&lock->l_pending_chain, list);
02169                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
02170         }
02171 
02172         return LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE;
02173 }
02174 
02175 static int replay_lock_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
02176                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02177                                  struct ldlm_async_args *aa, int rc)
02178 {
02179         struct ldlm_lock     *lock;
02180         struct ldlm_reply    *reply;
02181         struct obd_export    *exp;
02182 
02183         ENTRY;
02184         atomic_dec(&req->rq_import->imp_replay_inflight);
02185         if (rc != ELDLM_OK)
02186                 GOTO(out, rc);
02187 
02188         reply = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
02189         if (reply == NULL)
02190                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
02191 
02192         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(&aa->lock_handle);
02193         if (!lock) {
02194                 CERROR("received replay ack for unknown local cookie "LPX64
02195                        " remote cookie "LPX64 " from server %s id %s\n",
02196                        aa->lock_handle.cookie, reply->lock_handle.cookie,
02197                        req->rq_export->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
02198                        libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer));
02199                 GOTO(out, rc = -ESTALE);
02200         }
02201 
02202         /* Key change rehash lock in per-export hash with new key */
02203         exp = req->rq_export;
02204         if (exp && exp->exp_lock_hash) {
02205                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
02206                  * ldlm_export_lock_keycmp() */
02207                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
02208                 cfs_hash_rehash_key(exp->exp_lock_hash,
02209                                     &lock->l_remote_handle,
02210                                     &reply->lock_handle,
02211                                     &lock->l_exp_hash);
02212         } else {
02213                 lock->l_remote_handle = reply->lock_handle;
02214         }
02215 
02216         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "replayed lock:");
02217         ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(req->rq_import);
02218         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02219 out:
02220         if (rc != ELDLM_OK)
02221                 ptlrpc_connect_import(req->rq_import);
02222 
02223         RETURN(rc);
02224 }
02225 
02226 static int replay_one_lock(struct obd_import *imp, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02227 {
02228         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02229         struct ldlm_async_args *aa;
02230         struct ldlm_request   *body;
02231         int flags;
02232         ENTRY;
02233 
02234 
02235         /* Bug 11974: Do not replay a lock which is actively being canceled */
02236         if (ldlm_is_canceling(lock)) {
02237                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "Not replaying canceled lock:");
02238                 RETURN(0);
02239         }
02240 
02241         /* If this is reply-less callback lock, we cannot replay it, since
02242          * server might have long dropped it, but notification of that event was
02243          * lost by network. (and server granted conflicting lock already) */
02244         if (ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock)) {
02245                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "Not replaying reply-less lock:");
02246                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
02247                 RETURN(0);
02248         }
02249 
02250         /*
02251          * If granted mode matches the requested mode, this lock is granted.
02252          *
02253          * If they differ, but we have a granted mode, then we were granted
02254          * one mode and now want another: ergo, converting.
02255          *
02256          * If we haven't been granted anything and are on a resource list,
02257          * then we're blocked/waiting.
02258          *
02259          * If we haven't been granted anything and we're NOT on a resource list,
02260          * then we haven't got a reply yet and don't have a known disposition.
02261          * This happens whenever a lock enqueue is the request that triggers
02262          * recovery.
02263          */
02264         if (lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode)
02265                 flags = LDLM_FL_REPLAY | LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
02266         else if (lock->l_granted_mode)
02267                 flags = LDLM_FL_REPLAY | LDLM_FL_BLOCK_CONV;
02268         else if (!list_empty(&lock->l_res_link))
02269                 flags = LDLM_FL_REPLAY | LDLM_FL_BLOCK_WAIT;
02270         else
02271                 flags = LDLM_FL_REPLAY;
02272 
02273         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE,
02274                                         LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION, LDLM_ENQUEUE);
02275         if (req == NULL)
02276                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02277 
02278         /* We're part of recovery, so don't wait for it. */
02279         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_LOCKS;
02280 
02281         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
02282         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &body->lock_desc);
02283         body->lock_flags = ldlm_flags_to_wire(flags);
02284 
02285         ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &body->lock_handle[0]);
02286         if (lock->l_lvb_len > 0)
02287                 req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE_LVB);
02288         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
02289                              lock->l_lvb_len);
02290         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02291         /* notify the server we've replayed all requests.
02292          * also, we mark the request to be put on a dedicated
02293          * queue to be processed after all request replayes.
02294          * bug 6063 */
02295         lustre_msg_set_flags(req->rq_reqmsg, MSG_REQ_REPLAY_DONE);
02296 
02297         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "replaying lock:");
02298 
02299         atomic_inc(&req->rq_import->imp_replay_inflight);
02300         CLASSERT(sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
02301         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
02302         aa->lock_handle = body->lock_handle[0];
02303         req->rq_interpret_reply = (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)replay_lock_interpret;
02304         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
02305 
02306         RETURN(0);
02307 }
02308 
02319 static void ldlm_cancel_unused_locks_for_replay(struct ldlm_namespace *ns)
02320 {
02321         int canceled;
02322         struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
02323 
02324         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Dropping as many unused locks as possible before"
02325                            "replay for namespace %s (%d)\n",
02326                            ldlm_ns_name(ns), ns->ns_nr_unused);
02327 
02328         /* We don't need to care whether or not LRU resize is enabled
02329          * because the LDLM_LRU_FLAG_NO_WAIT policy doesn't use the
02330          * count parameter */
02331         canceled = ldlm_cancel_lru_local(ns, &cancels, ns->ns_nr_unused, 0,
02332                                          LCF_LOCAL, LDLM_LRU_FLAG_NO_WAIT);
02333 
02334         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Canceled %d unused locks from namespace %s\n",
02335                            canceled, ldlm_ns_name(ns));
02336 }
02337 
02338 int ldlm_replay_locks(struct obd_import *imp)
02339 {
02340         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = imp->imp_obd->obd_namespace;
02341         struct list_head list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(list);
02342         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *next;
02343         int rc = 0;
02344 
02345         ENTRY;
02346 
02347         LASSERT(atomic_read(&imp->imp_replay_inflight) == 0);
02348 
02349         /* don't replay locks if import failed recovery */
02350         if (imp->imp_vbr_failed)
02351                 RETURN(0);
02352 
02353         /* ensure this doesn't fall to 0 before all have been queued */
02354         atomic_inc(&imp->imp_replay_inflight);
02355 
02356         if (ldlm_cancel_unused_locks_before_replay)
02357                 ldlm_cancel_unused_locks_for_replay(ns);
02358 
02359         ldlm_namespace_foreach(ns, ldlm_chain_lock_for_replay, &list);
02360 
02361         list_for_each_entry_safe(lock, next, &list, l_pending_chain) {
02362                 list_del_init(&lock->l_pending_chain);
02363                 if (rc) {
02364                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02365                         continue; /* or try to do the rest? */
02366                 }
02367                 rc = replay_one_lock(imp, lock);
02368                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02369         }
02370 
02371         atomic_dec(&imp->imp_replay_inflight);
02372 
02373         RETURN(rc);
02374 }
